page.title: 04History of Filey Fishing.
page.content: In 1897 400 men earned their living from the sea and lots of families helped.Wives and daughters gathered bait on the beach towards Cayton Bay for "flithers"(limpets)Inthe late 1930's the number of cobles had dropped to below 40, and in 1953,there were only 10.There has been a revival in recent years and youngsters have come back to the boats.In 1977 there were around 50 men employed in the fishing industry.There were 14,3 man cobles and 3,2 man boats.Launching and landing a boat at Filey is difficult because there is no harbour,a tractor has to pull the boats in and out of the sea.
